subtitleNullable: The Serotonin theory of Depression and Tryptophan Depletion.
descriptionNullable:
**Europeans use of antidepressants more than doubles in 20 years.**

*Use of antidepressants increased by nearly two and a half times between 2000 and 2020 in 18 European countries, Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) data shows.*

 [Link](https://futurecarecapital.org.uk/latest/europeans-use-of-antidepressants-doubles/) to an article from Future Care Capital.

**The idea that depression is the result of abnormalities in brain chemicals, particularly serotonin (5-hydroxytryptamine or 5-HT), has been influential for decades, and provides an important justification for the use of antidepressants.**

*The below review suggests that the huge research effort based on the serotonin hypothesis has not produced convincing evidence of a biochemical basis to depression. This is consistent with research on many other biological markers. We suggest it is time to acknowledge that the serotonin theory of depression is not empirically substantiated.*

[Link](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41380-022-01661-0) to a systematic review from Molecular Psychiatry. 

**Analysis: Depression is probably not caused by a chemical imbalance in the brain.**

[Link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ODav3kFm_bIPJ9lAT2AL0InM3j60ISPxKnMe-Wq9GWo/edit?usp=sharing) to a document about SSRI antidepressants.

*We conclude that it is impossible to say that taking SSRI antidepressants is worthwhile, or even completely safe. People need all this information to make informed decisions about whether or not to take antidepressants.*

[Link](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/2022/jul/analysis-depression-probably-not-caused-chemical-imbalance-brain-new-study#:~:text=We%20conclude%20that%20it%20is,Conversation%20on%2020%20July%202022.) to an article from UCL News.

**Antidepressants are not associated with improved quality of life in the long run, study finds.** 

*Over time, using antidepressants is not associated with significantly better health-related quality of life, compared to people with depression who do not take the drugs, according to a new study.*

[Link](https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2022/04/220420151555.htm) to an article from Science Daily.

**Data Visualisations.**

A [link](http://rpubs.com/Paddy_5142/1073652) to a Markdown document with code chunks and two basic scatter plots, using data from census.csv.

The following spreadsheets are edited versions of the original data as uploaded (census.csv).

Using data from only Sweden from 2007 to 2017, using two age groups: 5-9 years old and 10-19 years old.

**Group 1:** 5-9 years old. A [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1l6D2tDBbLMhDDoMkkGn45cJk1Al-BJJlgSnz9AeILa0/edit?usp=sharing) to an edited spreadsheet and bar chart. 

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2Fd1666bcda386fb8a6577d6c2bafe7b29%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2014.06.40.png?generation=1692191292935092&alt=media)

**Group 2:** 10-19 years old. A [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LUb-ZdVIhaDZr8z0zj6r46CnfacSf3dgQYA9ZJyhiMI/edit?usp=sharing) to an edited spreadsheet and bar chart. 

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2Fab165fd25b2a97d9bb135e52466755f4%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2014.08.46.png?generation=1692191417619734&alt=media)

As the data from Sweden shows, a lot of 5-19 year old children and adolescents were prescribed antidepressants between 2007-2017. With a noticeable uptrend in the numbers of users in the 5-9 year old, children's age group.

**Can you eat foods to boost Serotonin levels ?** 

Tryptophan is an essential amino acid that cannot be produced by the human body and must be obtained through your diet, primarily from animal or plant based protein sources.

Tryptophan plays a role in the production of serotonin, a mood stabiliser, melatonin, which helps regulate sleep patterns, niacin or vitamin B-3, and nicotinamide also known as vitamin B-3 - signs of severe niacin deficiency include depression.

Tryptophan has the lowest concentration in the body of any amino acid, yet, it is vital for a wide variety of metabolic functions that affect your mood, cognition, and behaviour.
 
[Link](https://www.webmd.com/diet/foods-high-in-tryptophan) to an article from WebMD about Tryptophan.

Foods that are high in Tryptophan. [Link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RF_1uR3pzYA1icMqaX8oiOVwuOSeNkmpAF2knaIa00Y/edit?usp=sharing)

Vegetarian & Vegan foods high in Tryptophan. [Link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ON2Ym3vtAU1T5eEBL4xn-QOcMNKBv_v-WxpFKfdNso4/edit?usp=sharing)


**The determinants of mental health and well being are largely about the society we live in, rather than medical.**

[Link](https://research.senedd.wales/research-articles/poverty-and-mental-health-it-s-a-two-way-street/#:~:text=Poverty%20is%20clearly%20linked%20with,and%20anxiety%2C%20and%20substance%20misuse.) to an excellent article from the Welsh Parliament, titled '*Poverty and mental health: it’s a two-way street* '

A meta-analysis published in The Lancet in 2018 analysed 522 trials including 116,477 participants and found all 21 of the antidepressants studied to be more effective than placebo in the treatment of **Major Depressive disorder in adults.**
Titled *"Comparative efficacy and acceptability of 21 antidepressant drugs for the acute treatment of adults with major depressive disorder: a systematic review and network meta-analysis."*

[link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qdwZ0w3fAPSvLNEaOPsz3jQrNzeFuvQpxhhLNpr37Tw/edit?usp=sharing) To a document entitled - *The effects of Alcohol and Nicotine with Mental Health Medications.*

**Conclusions and a Q&A about screen usage.**

While it is accurate to say that the response to antidepressants can be variable and they are not effective in all cases and antidepressants have been found to be less effective in mild cases of depression as compared to severe cases. Antidepressants also come with potential side effects, which must be weighed against their potential benefits in each individual case.

Concerns have been raised about over prescription of antidepressants in some cases, especially when it comes to mild or situational depression. There's also an ongoing debate about their long-term use and potential withdrawal effects. It's essential for healthcare providers to ensure that they are used appropriately, and that other interventions such as psychotherapy and diet are considered.

Many studies suggest antidepressants can be an effective treatment for many individuals with depression, especially when used in conjunction with other treatments. However, the conversation around their use is complex and multifaceted, and ongoing research is important to continue refining our understanding of these drugs and their role in treatment.

*I asked Chat-GPT(3.5):*

*Hi, does screen time negatively affect levels of hormones? If so, which hormones and why?*

[Link](https://rpubs.com/Paddy_5142/1071543) *to the answer.*


Immunity and the Connections of Mental Well Being.
The Power of Food to Strengthen the Immune System, to Protect Us. [link](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/patricklford/immunity-and-the-connections-of-mental-well-being) *To my project on Kaggle.*


Patrick Ford 🌞
